verses.verse: But when they urged him till he was (2 Kin. 8:11) ashamed, he said, “Send them!” Therefore they sent fifty men, and they searched for three days but did not find him.
And when they came back to him, for he had stayed in Jericho, he said to them, “Did I not say to you, ‘Do not go’?”
Elisha Performs Miracles Then the men of the city said to Elisha, “Please notice, the situation of this city is pleasant, as my lord sees; but the water is bad, and the ground barren.”
And he said, “Bring me a new bowl, and put salt in it.” So they brought it to him.

Then he went out to the source of the water, and (Ex. 15:25, 26; 2 Kin. 4:41; 6:6; John 9:6) cast in the salt there, and said, “Thus says the LORD: ‘I have healed this water; from it there shall be no more death or barrenness.’ ”
So the water remains (Ezek. 47:8, 9) healed to this day, according to the word of Elisha which he spoke.
Then he went up from there to Bethel; and as he was going up the road, some youths came from the city and mocked him, and said to him, “Go up, you baldhead! Go up, you baldhead!”
So he turned around and looked at them, and (Deut. 27:13-26) pronounced a curse on them in the name of the LORD. And two female bears came out of the woods and mauled forty-two of the youths.
Then he went from there to (1 Kin. 18:19, 20; 2 Kin. 4:25) Mount Carmel, and from there he returned to Samaria.
Moab Rebels Against Israel Now (2 Kin. 1:17) Jehoram the son of Ahab became king over Israel at Samaria in the eighteenth year of Jehoshaphat king of Judah, and reigned twelve years.
And he did evil in the sight of the LORD, but not like his father and mother; for he put away the sacred pillar of Baal (1 Kin. 16:31, 32) that his father had made.
Nevertheless he persisted in (1 Kin. 12:28-32) the sins of Jeroboam the son of Nebat, who had made Israel sin; he did not depart from them.
Now Mesha king of Moab was a sheepbreeder, and he (2 Sam. 8:2) regularly paid the king of Israel one hundred thousand (Is. 16:1, 2) lambs and the wool of one hundred thousand rams.
But it happened, when (2 Kin. 1:1) Ahab died, that the king of Moab rebelled against the king of Israel.
So King Jehoram went out of Samaria at that time and mustered all Israel.

Then he went and sent to Jehoshaphat king of Judah, saying, “The king of Moab has rebelled against me. Will you go with me to fight against Moab?” And he said, “I will go up; (1 Kin. 22:4) I am as you are, my people as your people, my horses as your horses.”
Then he said, “Which way shall we go up?” And he answered, “By way of the Wilderness of Edom.”

So the king of Israel went with the king of Judah and the king of Edom, and they marched on that roundabout route seven days; and there was no water for the army, nor for the animals that followed them.
And the king of Israel said, “Alas! For the LORD has called these three kings together to deliver them into the hand of Moab.”

But (1 Kin. 22:7) Jehoshaphat said, “Is there no prophet of the LORD here, that we may inquire of the LORD by him?” So one of the servants of the king of Israel answered and said, “Elisha the son of Shaphat is here, who (1 Kin. 19:21; (John 13:4, 5, 13, 14)) poured water on the hands of Elijah.”
And Jehoshaphat said, “The word of the LORD is with him.” So the king of Israel and Jehoshaphat and the king of Edom (2 Kin. 2:25) went down to him.

Then Elisha said to the king of Israel, ((Ezek. 14:3)) “What have I to do with you? (Judg. 10:14; Ruth 1:15) Go to (1 Kin. 22:6-11) the prophets of your father and the (1 Kin. 18:19) prophets of your mother.” But the king of Israel said to him, “No, for the LORD has called these three kings together to deliver them into the hand of Moab.”

And Elisha said, (1 Kin. 17:1; 2 Kin. 5:16) “As the LORD of hosts lives, before whom I stand, surely were it not that I regard the presence of Jehoshaphat king of Judah, I would not look at you, nor see you.
But now bring me (1 Sam. 10:5) a musician.” Then it happened, when the musician (1 Sam. 16:16, 23; 1 Chr. 25:1) played, that (Ezek. 1:3; 3:14, 22; 8:1) the hand of the LORD came upon him.
And he said, “Thus says the LORD: (Jer. 14:3) ‘Make this valley full of ditches.’
For thus says the LORD: ‘You shall not see wind, nor shall you see rain; yet that valley shall be filled with water, so that you, your cattle, and your animals may drink.’
And this is a simple matter in the sight of the LORD; He will also deliver the Moabites into your hand.
